intro: Intybellia rosea, commonly known as the pink spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many other spurge species. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Intybellia rosea is noted for its ability to store water in its thick leaves, making it drought-tolerant.
